Hey Jay, Way to go! Congratulations! When do you think will be the earliest it will be distributed to health care workers?
Hey James prototypes are being produced by EnviroGuard on the suit side to be fast tracked in the certification process. More news as we get it but it is moving extremely fast
Hey Jay, I really like the idea! But how exactely does the cooling process work?

Hey Tobias, we have been cooling personnel in high heat stress environments for 17 years... Everything from Surgeons to NASCAR Drivers... We use several different cooling engines with our garments from simple Ice,Thermoelectric , Compressor Vapor Cycle and Liquid Co2. This suit has the capability to connect to all of our systems via a fixed port. It can be used with our MP2 Backpack or our 12 or 24L coolers. Our fixed systems have a auto retract hose feature that allow the person to move about without getting tangle in the hose that connects them.  If ice is not available our PROCOOL Co2 System converts liquid Co2 from a liquid to a gas through a patented manifold system and tubbing process.. Hope this helps
To see the above referenced products go to http://www.coolshirt.com

description: Our next generation suit will keep healthcare workers safer as they treat patients. In addition our cooling gear will ensure that they are comfortable,better focused, and better able to do their job while reducing cost and hazardous exposure by a 4 to 1 ratio.
summary: COOLSHIRT SYSTEMS and INERNATIONAL ENVIROGUARD will join forces to produce a COOLED hooded suit with integrated ear to ear face shield to pass ASTM 1670/1671  standards and be certified to EN14126. The suit is designed with easy to use tab/flapped Velcro with easy grab tabs along  with a reusable temporal  skin temperature sensor with audible alarm. The solution will also provide portable,fixed and or combined cooling during donning and undonning process. The system will allow caregivers to go from 40 minutes to 4 hours in the care POD. The  internal COOLING System designed for the suit will allow for decontamination,air-drying, and indefinite re-use.
